open_risks: Trade-policy escalation/retaliation cycle with Europe (tariffs, countermeasures, broader restrictions) extending risk-off and pressuring global growth expectations; also raises inflation uncertainty (tariff pass-through).
Adverse regime for equities if bond yields keep rising during equity drawdowns (tightening financial conditions + valuation compression), especially for duration-heavy sectors.
USD weakening alongside risk-off can amplify cross-asset volatility (EM/commodities/hedging flows) and complicate the typical hedging playbook.
Headline-driven gaps/liquidity air-pockets: policy/geopolitical tape bombs (tariff specifics, NATO/EU responses, Greenland developments) dominate systematic re-risking/de-risking.
Macro data catalyst risk: core PCE and labor data can reprice front-end expectations; if inflation surprises higher, it can reinforce the ‘bad mix’ of higher yields + weaker equities.
